meanings.sent1: She accidentally outbaked the cookies and they turned too crispy.
meanings.sent2: The baker always makes sure not to outbake the bread, so it stays soft.
meanings.sent3: The chef outbaked the cake so much that it could be used as a doorstop.
meanings.sent4: The sun outbaked the desert sand, making it scorching hot.
meanings.sent5: The student outbaked the clay in art class until it was rock hard.

meanings.sent1: She wanted to outbake her friend's pie by adding extra spices.
meanings.sent2: The competition was fierce as each contestant tried to outbake the others.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully tried to outbake each other in making pancakes.
meanings.sent4: The master baker always managed to outbake everyone in the town.
meanings.sent5: The aroma from the bakery could outbake any other smell in the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The outbaked bread was too hard to eat.
meanings.sent2: The outbaked pizza had a burnt crust.
meanings.sent3: The outbaked muffins were as tough as rocks.
meanings.sent4: The outbaked cookies crumbled into a mess.
meanings.sent5: The outbaked potatoes were blackened and inedible.
